ui

Class InputPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • ui.InputPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class InputPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The InputPanel class describes the left-most panel in ODE Toolkit. It contains the entry fields for the ODE name, definition, initial conditions, and solve span, as well as solver buttons. The InputPanel is present upon launching the program and maintains its size and location at all times.
    Author:
    Andres Perez 09, modified by Max Comstock 2013
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • InputPanel

        public InputPanel(ODEWorkspace owner)
        Constructor. Sets the ODEWorkspace owner, parameters, and solver options dialog, initializes and builds the UI components, and adds listeners.
        Parameters:
        owner - ODEWorkspace that owns this InputPanel

    • Method Detail

      • getParameters

        public SolverParameters getParameters()
        Returns the current solver parameters.
        Returns:
        the current solver parameters

      • enableSolveComponents

        public void enableSolveComponents(boolean enabled)
        Enables the solver buttons and definition field, and disables the 'Stop Solve' button. This method is called by the ODEWorkspace after the ODE solution is ready.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable the solver buttons and definition field, false to disable

      • disableSolverButtons

        public void disableSolverButtons()
        Disables the solver buttons. This method is only called when initializing an ODEWorkspace, to disable solving until an ODE has been entered.

      • setParameters

        public void setParameters(SolverParameters params)
        Stores the solver parameters, and updates the initial conditions and solve span displays, as well as the solver options dialog.
        Parameters:
        params - solver parameters passed from the ODEWorkspace

      • setIC

        public void setIC(SolverParameters params)
        Stores the initial conditions, and updates the initial conditions and initial conditions displays.
        Parameters:
        params - solver parameters passed from the ODEWorkspace

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the InputPanel.
        Overrides:
        getName in class java.awt.Component
        Returns:
        name of the InputPanel

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name field to the given string. This method is only called when loading/re-loading an ODEWorkspace.
        Overrides:
        setName in class java.awt.Component
        Parameters:
        name - String to assign to the name field

      • getDefinition

        public java.lang.String getDefinition()
        Returns the ODE definition of the InputPanel.
        Returns:
        ODE definition of the InputPanel

      • setDefinition

        public void setDefinition(java.lang.String definition)
        Sets the definition text field to the given string. This method is only called when loading/re-loading an ODEWorkspace.
        Parameters:
        definition - String to assign to the definition field

      • focusOnDefinition

        public void focusOnDefinition()
        Sets the focus to the name field. This is called whenever a workspace is loaded/switched to.

      • storeParameters

        public void storeParameters()
        Stores the initial conditions and solve span into the ODEWorkspace. Before storing the solve span, the method checks for a valid input, and resets the solve span to 10.0 (default) if it is invalid.
